document.docAuthor: ZHOU, YU-LINGZI, BORDONI, ARNALDO & ZHOU, HONG-ZHANG
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the genus Megalinus Mulsant & Rey (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae, Xantholinini) and seven new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of the genus Megalinus Mulsant & Rey (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae, Xantholinini) and seven new species from China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Lemiganus Bordoni, 1985: 86
(species included:
elianae
; type species:
Xantholinus elianae Jarrige
, fixed by original designation and monotypy);
Smetana, 2004: 689
(catalog);
Bordoni, 2012b: 170
(synonym of
Megalinus
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Staphylinus glabratus Gravenhorst, 1802: 178
, fixed by monotypy.

Diagnosis :
Megalinus
can be distinguished from all other genera within the tribe Xantholinini by the following characters: a) body subcylindrical, usually medium to large in size ( 7–10 mm ), few ca. 6 mm ; b) head subquadrate or subrectangular, with round, deep and sparse punctures, some bearing microsculpture; c) frontal furrows and anteocular furrows normally quite long and deep; d) antennomere II and III elongate, subequal in length or II longer; e) labrum bilobed, with medial longitudinal furrow; f) last segment of maxillary and labial palpi elongate and longest; g) gular sutures not fused together, separated by the shallowly excavated gular plate; h) neck slightly wider than 1/3 of head width; i) pronotum normally with paired admedian and lateral rows of punctures, some bearing numerous rows of punctures; j) antesternal plate with a longitudinal medium furrow; k) superior line of hypomeron bending toward prosternum before anterior angle of pronotum, but not joining inferior line; l) each elytron bearing several rows of punctures; m) protarsi not dilated, only protibiae with subapical ctenidia; n) median lobe of aedeagus large sized, anterior portion short, departed from basal bulb, inner sac of varied shape and composition; o) female genital segments composing of transverse sternite, and a pair of subtriangular sclerites.
